# MTL4FXSpatialScaler

**Protocol**

An upscaling effect that generates a higher resolution texture in a render pass by spatially analyzing an input texture.

## Declaration

```swift
protocol MTL4FXSpatialScaler : MTLFXSpatialScalerBase
```

## Overview

You create instances of this class by calling [doc://com.apple.metalfx/documentation/MetalFX/MTLFXSpatialScalerDescriptor/makeSpatialScaler(device:compiler:)].

When using instances of objects conforming to this protocol, you configure the different properties it inherits from protocol [doc://com.apple.metalfx/documentation/MetalFX/MTLFXSpatialScalerBase] and then call [doc://com.apple.metalfx/documentation/MetalFX/MTL4FXSpatialScaler/encode(commandBuffer:)] to encode its work into a Metal command buffer.

See [doc://com.apple.metalfx/documentation/MetalFX/MTLFXSpatialScalerBase] for more details on configuring and using spatial scalers.

## Instance Methods

- **encode(commandBuffer:)**: Encode this spatial scaler work into a command buffer.

## Inherits From

- MTLFXSpatialScalerBase
- NSObjectProtocol

items.description: Encode this spatial scaler work into a command buffer.
items.name: encode(commandBuffer:)
